website_summaries.verdict: Constructed of stainless steel, these shears cost slightly more than some others, but most owners find them to be valuable and well made.
pros: the scissors are easy to control

customer_reviews.title: Product Switching
customer_reviews.text: Shears received were not the ones described or pictured, buyer beware. Shears received did not have a oxygen wrench cutout on blade, were not made in USA and did not have the "comfort no-slip" grips.
customer_reviews.author: TacticalTim

customer_reviews.title: Caution! Product delivered not as pictured.
customer_reviews.text: The shears received were not the shears pictured. I was replacing a lost shear of the same item bought in 2015. The previous ones were excellent, Made In USA product. The ones received were junk from Pakistan. Handles did not align when closed. Very cheap metal finish. Cheap plastic handles that were stained. Returning immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Lacostelo

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good quality, NOT made in USA
customer_reviews.text: Looks like the production might have moved - mine are marked Singapore but otherwise look & feel like the real deal. Has all the correct markings, including the correct NSN and feels like a good quality unit. Time will tell. One star less for moving production from the US to Singapore even if the quality is similar.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M.

customer_reviews.title: Best Pair of Trauma Shears
customer_reviews.text: I am have been an EMT for 4 years. These are one of my favorite pair of trauma shears and I have used them hundreds of times. They are lightweight, durable, sharp, and the oxygen tank key is helpful in a pinch. While I have a pair of leatherman raptors that I now carry in my bag, these are my go-to trauma shears when I'm looking for lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Macchi

customer_reviews.title: Shears are cheap imitation!
customer_reviews.text: The shears I received are NOT genuine NAR shears. Shears are cheap knockoffs... They do not have the NAR logo, do not have the rubberized grips and are obviously lesser quality.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Cut through leather like buttahhhh
customer_reviews.text: Lost these on an accident scene but they cut straight through jeans, a shirt and a leather vest like nothing. So good that I bought a second pair to replace them. Always have these in my med bag. Great value!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Trauma Shears!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome trauma shears! The look good and will cut through practically anything. I tested them on an old shirt and I cut through it in 4 seconds! Great shears, absolutely worth buying!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Reichart

customer_reviews.title: Cheapest Pakistani crap imaginable.
customer_reviews.text: I purchase these because they were advertised as made in the USA. Well, they are marked Pakistan and are about as cheaply made as I have ever seen. Bait and switch and they are going back!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Smith

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck, period.
customer_reviews.text: I've had tons of these shears, they're the only traditional trauma shears worth buying. I've always lost them before I've worn them out.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth B.

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: Ordered from one of the other vendors who had an excellent rating. Came as described. Only thing I'm not keen on is it keeps getting lost in our dark patterned area rug where I tape my ankles, but then I knew it was black when I ordered it - it just might be a reason to find one with colored handles. Other than that - absolutely no complaints. I'd order it again.
customer_reviews.author: caprae

customer_reviews.title: Switch and bare not happy with these.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in trauma shears that I ordered. Feels like Switch and bate. Ordered the 7 1/4 and received 5 1/2. Had no oxygen key as the one I ordered. Can’t get my fingers hardly in these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Feel duped.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these over a year ago. Said North American Rescue. Very good quality. Just bought another pair for my secondary bag, these feel cheap, feel or look NOTHING like the ones i had bought a year and a half ago. The newer pair dont even have the NAR logo or the rubberized finger holes as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: I have a number of EMT shears and this is definitely the highest quality one I own and my primary one.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Cook

customer_reviews.title: Good for what they are designed for.
customer_reviews.text: These scissors are good for what they're made for: cutting bandages, tape, cloth, even tough material like leather and dense man made material (think seatbelt). They are a bit "light weight" though. Someone asked me if they would cut metal like the ones shown on various media sources. These are not the scissors that will cut, oh say, a penny in two. Though the two different scissors look similar, these scissors are for material, not for cutting up pocket change.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Cast

customer_reviews.title: Quality shears
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. Time will tell, but these cut well and seem like they will last. Much better than some of the other cheaper alternatives I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Moore

customer_reviews.title: Rubber coating on the handles are a plus
customer_reviews.text: I like the handles of these shears. Most are made with plastic. This has a little rubber coating which helps. I have these in a pouch on my molle. Used for seatbelts and clothing. So far they have cut flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Jr

customer_reviews.title: Read reviews carefully!
customer_reviews.text: These may be durable, a good value, and light weight, but they sure are not made in the USA! SINGAPORE is stamped on the handle. Buyer beware--the review states these are made in the USA and they are not.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Glory

customer_reviews.title: Excellent trauma shears
customer_reviews.text: Excellent trauma shears. They are sharp, have rubberized handles for a good grip, and the price is extremely reasonable. The oxygen wrench is a nice feature. These are by far the best trauma shears considering the value for the price; the Leatherman Raptor has more features, but that tool is six times as expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Doublewolf

customer_reviews.title: North American Rescue 71/4 " Shears
customer_reviews.text: I like the quality of these scissors they work for flawlessly.... Will be ordering another pair very soon.... Thank you so very much.... Everyone please be safe...
customer_reviews.author: John D Yashura

customer_reviews.title: Not the real North American Trauma sheers
customer_reviews.text: The sheers that arrived were not North American Trauma Sheers - and they were a super cheap copy. Not worth the bother to return these. But a big rip off.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Ekelman

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic shears. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely wonderful shears for shibari and anything else! Crazy tough and well made. Can cut through a penny without harming the edges. I've cut 1 inch hemp and nylon ropes under tension with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: JohnL

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: NAR is a reputable company that makes some of the best medical supplies out there.
customer_reviews.author: Zak

customer_reviews.title: Can't Go Wrong
customer_reviews.text: These work great! I try to not use them too often so they are ready to rock in the event i need to use them for an emergency, but they stay with my gear everyday. Can't go wrong with NAR.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Edwards

customer_reviews.title: these work like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Well, these work like a charm! So far I've cut clothes, splints (the foam and metal type), cans, thick fabrics, and counting. They're great! And what's even better, I didn't have to pay $70 for them. I'm not sure how long they'll retain their sharpness, but so far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Great shears, get these and don’t settle on some ...
customer_reviews.text: Great shears, get these and don’t settle on some BS shears or scissors from inferior companies. Someone’s life is depending on these to work without creating more damage. Buy. Them. Now.
customer_reviews.author: Cmonty2100

customer_reviews.title: Durable & Dependable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my EMT clinicals. Strong and sturdy, with a nice matte-black finish.
customer_reviews.author: texasfire_cross

customer_reviews.title: and I'm happy about that
customer_reviews.text: Still using the scissors after three years. I purchased two pair of these, originally, and still haven't had the need to use my second pair. Works as intended, they cut clothes rapidly off of unresponsive people, and I'm happy about that.
customer_reviews.author: Bocklin47

customer_reviews.title: Great shears
customer_reviews.text: As described, NAR tm. Singapore mfg magnetic (low nickel) stainless.
customer_reviews.author: Robert In Houston

customer_reviews.title: Rural EMS
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed with a solid feel. Cuts through heavy canvas pants, two layers of thermals easily. Oxygen wrench already came in handy when the plastic knob on O2 bottle went missing on a call.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love em! I work in an ER and I ...
customer_reviews.text: Love em! I work in an ER and I am continuously pulling out shears for everything. I like a pair that won't quit on me too quickly. They last a long time. They look sleek and have a great grip. I wil exclusively be buying these shears
customer_reviews.author: ruth megido

customer_reviews.title: Great shears
customer_reviews.text: So far I’m really enjoying this. Great grip and cutting power. Also has a NSN issue number
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: it is a professional item
customer_reviews.text: this medical scissor works very well. It cuts every clothes!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nicola

customer_reviews.title: Bought as gift.
customer_reviews.text: I'm told all the co-workers want a pair. Informal tests have been performed between these and the "Raptors" these win!
customer_reviews.author: Natstelle

customer_reviews.title: Great, basic shear.
customer_reviews.text: Great, basic paramedic shear. Lightweight and practical. The blade is not the strongest but for the money it will perform all basic first aid needs.
customer_reviews.author: Robert James

customer_reviews.title: Good Shear. Will cut through most anything I have ...
customer_reviews.text: Good Shear. Will cut through most anything I have to cut, from leather, steel wool, sandpaper, emery cloth and whatever else I have to cut in the shop.
customer_reviews.author: PhotoPro

customer_reviews.title: Great product for your first aid kit
customer_reviews.text: Owned another set beforehand. They stayed sharp throughout the whole deployment, with multiple uses and constant abuse from sand, mud, and water in canals! The only reason I bought another pair is because my old pair got swiped. Glad to have it back on my kit.
customer_reviews.author: robb hansen

customer_reviews.title: Bait and Switch
customer_reviews.text: The item I received was no where close to the one shown in the picture. They felt cheap and looked cheap... They were indeed cheap. The handle was made out of low grade plastic and would go past the stop. They were described as having "soft-grip, non-slip contoured handles", this was certainly not the case. The blades were not premium stainless steel, they just looked like thin steel that could barely cut.
customer_reviews.author: Jason K.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, worked good for the six months I ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product, worked good for the six months I used them, cut everything like butter from leather boots to motorcycle jackets. They were contaminated with blood so I threw them away. We'll see how long this next pair last me.
customer_reviews.author: Q

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp and durable
customer_reviews.text: So durable it cut a penny in half. Gifts perfect on the molle attachment of my trauma kit
customer_reviews.author: John G

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shears
customer_reviews.text: These shears are so smooth. These shears cut through everything like butter. Had a trauma patient the other day and took no effort to cut the clothes off. Totally recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Danny Cruz

customer_reviews.title: As pictured
customer_reviews.text: I received item just like the picture. Oxygen slot, color and size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Very well made pair of trauma shears, oxygen key is handy for when you don't have one. Handles have a sort of "felt" it seems to make them a little less slick.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!!
customer_reviews.text: These things are outstanding! Affordable Reliable Extremely effective one hand cutting Durable Simple Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Whitson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing shears! I've always been a loyal fan of NAR!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing shears! I've always been a loyal fan of NAR!
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: As an ER nurse I have learned these things are ...
customer_reviews.text: As an ER nurse I have learned these things are indestructible. They are made of high quality steel that stays sharp for a long time!
customer_reviews.author: David Irvan

customer_reviews.title: A little tight
customer_reviews.text: The hinge is a little tight, but cuts very well. I guess tighter is better than too loose.
customer_reviews.author: GS

customer_reviews.title: Terrible not as described or the picture shown
customer_reviews.text: Terrible not as described or the picture shown. They are very cheaply made and look to have been abused. I don't like leaving bad reviews, but this was a bait and switch.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy

customer_reviews.title: Totally disappointment
customer_reviews.text: It wasn't the one shown in the picture. Looks very cheap. Totally disappointment. Turned back...
customer_reviews.author: Emre

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Two purposes are better than one, price is a little high but it terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ferrero

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sharp. I don't have to keep chomping at material like my old pair of scissors.
customer_reviews.author: WBJR

customer_reviews.title: From what I can tell so far these seem like nice Medic shears
customer_reviews.text: From what I can tell so far these seem like nice Medic shears. Very sharp and love the all black.
customer_reviews.author: Jenifer Sneiderwine

customer_reviews.title: Fast shipping and good price
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a standard grade import shear, good enough if you're not using it frequently. Used for emergency kit.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M.

customer_reviews.title: durability
customer_reviews.text: This part of my blow out kit. like the robust build
customer_reviews.author: David A Speigle

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shears and a very good addition to any kit.
customer_reviews.author: Duckman

customer_reviews.title: Frame appears to be stamped steal rather than cast or ...
customer_reviews.text: Frame appears to be stamped steal rather than cast or forged --- very light weight but does the job well.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Packard

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and sharp
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and sharp, durable blades! I also love the black, tactical look. FYI, this product is made in Singapore.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Love this NAR product!
customer_reviews.text: Affordable and gets the bandage/clothing cutting job done. I'm not one to spend half a paycheck on trauma shears (I have a tendency to misplace things on occasion) and these are great. Solid product.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Janssen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These will cut nearly anything you will find an average person wearing on a daily basis.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Not a super smooth shear, but gets the job done
customer_reviews.author: Reginald Riggins

customer_reviews.title: These are a great pair of shears def worth the extra couple bucks ...
customer_reviews.text: These are a great pair of shears def worth the extra couple bucks over the rest. Finally can cut through a roll of gauze rather then chomping a little at a time. Def would buy again!!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa DuPriest

customer_reviews.title: Some of the best medical sheers I've seen and used
customer_reviews.text: Some of the best medical sheers I've seen and used! Well built and exceptional quality. As a prank, no kinky crap, we zip-tied and duct taped one of our guys at our department. When it was over these cut through multiple layers of duct tape and the extra large zip ties used for duct work like it was butter. Not to mention cutting through clothes is a joke.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler C.

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but the best
customer_reviews.text: Nothing else like them, These suckers can cut through anything
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: These are only a few dollars more than the other choices, wich I purchased previously, and worth triple the money. Excellent quality and feel (rubber handles instead of plastic).
customer_reviews.author: C. Pierce

customer_reviews.title: seem to be a good tool.
customer_reviews.text: Just got them in, seem to be a good tool.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Sharpest Trauma Shears
customer_reviews.text: These are the sharpest trauma shears I have ever used. I have put them through everything but a leather jacket (haven't had the change to try) without much effort.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are the best pair of trauma sheers I have ever used!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: A high quality product, as to be expected from ...
customer_reviews.text: A high quality product, as to be expected from one of the most reputable tactical medical suppliers, North American Rescue.
customer_reviews.author: Hannibal

customer_reviews.title: Great Shears
customer_reviews.text: Have 2 sets of shears, one for ems and one for the fire department. These are definately worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: B. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Best shears I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Best shears I have ever owned. They cut like a dream and have a nice tight fit even after several months of use. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: justin

product_meta.title: North American Rescue Trauma Shear, 7 1/4"
feature_bullets: Premium-grade stainless steel with precision sharpness
Enhanced serrated lower edge cuts through the toughest materials
Clothing-lift lip and rounded tip for ultimate patient safety
Soft-grip, non-slip contoured handles for maximum control even when wet
L 7.25 in. x W 3.7 in. x D 0.4 in.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars203 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
